episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and historical facts, including fashion trends involving live animals, Alan Turing's lost treasure, the peculiarities of sperm banks, and the surprising linguistic influence of Hawaiian on English.

facts.fact: It was fashionable in New York at the end of the 19th century for ladies to wear live lizards as brooches.
The great code breaker, Alan Turing, lost his buried treasure when he couldn't crack his own code.
In 2011, the largest sperm bank in the world stopped accepting sperm from redheads.
The English language has more words borrowed from Hawaiian than it has from Welsh.
